get.summary: Gets all accident details for accidents occuring in the specified year

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year for which to filter the accidents on.

get.summary: Gets air quality data feed

Gets all bike point locations. The Place object has an addtionalProperties array which contains the nbBikes, nbDocks and nbSpaces
            numbers which give the status of the BikePoint. A mismatch in these numbers i.e. nbDocks - (nbBikes + nbSpaces) != 0 indicates broken docks.
Gets the bike point with the given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A bike point id (a list of ids can be obtained from the above BikePoint call)

get.summary:
Search for bike stations by their name, a bike point's name often contains information about the name of the street
            or nearby landmarks, for example. Note that the search result does not contain the PlaceProperties i.e. the status
            or occupancy of the BikePoint, to get that information you should retrieve the BikePoint by its id on /BikePoint/id.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search term e.g. "St. James"

get.summary: Gets taxis and minicabs contact information

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Longitude

parameters.name: optype
parameters.description: Operator Type e.g Minicab, Executive, Limousine

parameters.name: wc
parameters.description: Wheelchair accessible

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius of the bounding circle in metres

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Trading name of operating company

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the number of results return. Default and maximum is 20.

parameters.name: legacyFormat
parameters.description: Legacy Format

parameters.name: forceXml
parameters.description: Force Xml

parameters.name: twentyFourSevenOnly
parameters.description: Twenty Four Seven Only

get.summary: Gets a list of all of the available journey planner modes
Perform a Journey Planner search from the parameters specified in simple types

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Origin of the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Destination of the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

parameters.name: via
parameters.description: Travel through point on the journey. Can be WGS84 coordinates expressed as "lat,long", a UK postcode, a Naptan (StopPoint) id, an ICS StopId, or a free-text string (will cause disambiguation unless it exactly matches a point of interest name).

parameters.name: nationalSearch
parameters.description: Does the journey cover stops outside London? eg. "nationalSearch=true"

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date must be in yyyyMMdd format

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time must be in HHmm format

parameters.name: timeIs
parameters.description: Does the time given relate to arrival or leaving time? Possible options: "departing" | "arriving"

parameters.name: journeyPreference
parameters.description: The journey preference eg possible options: "leastinterchange" | "leasttime" | "leastwalking"

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode must be a comma separated list of modes. eg possible options: "public-bus,overground,train,tube,coach,dlr,cablecar,tram,river,walking,cycle"

parameters.name: accessibilityPreference
parameters.description: The accessibility preference must be a comma separated list eg. "noSolidStairs,noEscalators,noElevators,stepFreeToVehicle,stepFreeToPlatform"

parameters.name: fromName
parameters.description: An optional name to associate with the origin of the journey in the results.

parameters.name: toName
parameters.description: An optional name to associate with the destination of the journey in the results.

parameters.name: viaName
parameters.description: An optional name to associate with the via point of the journey in the results.

parameters.name: maxTransferMinutes
parameters.description: The max walking time in minutes for transfer eg. "120"

parameters.name: maxWalkingMinutes
parameters.description: The max walking time in minutes for journeys eg. "120"

parameters.name: walkingSpeed
parameters.description: The walking speed. eg possible options: "slow" | "average" | "fast".

parameters.name: cyclePreference
parameters.description: The cycle preference. eg possible options: "allTheWay" | "leaveAtStation" | "takeOnTransport" | "cycleHire"

parameters.name: adjustment
parameters.description: Time adjustment command. eg possible options: "TripFirst" | "TripLast"

parameters.name: bikeProficiency
parameters.description: A comma separated list of cycling proficiency levels. eg possible options: "easy,moderate,fast"

parameters.name: alternativeCycle
parameters.description: Option to determine whether to return alternative cycling journey

parameters.name: alternativeWalking
parameters.description: Option to determine whether to return alternative walking journey

parameters.name: applyHtmlMarkup
parameters.description: Flag to determine whether certain text (e.g. walking instructions) should be output with HTML tags or not.

parameters.name: useMultiModalCall
parameters.description: A boolean to indicate whether or not to return 3 public transport journeys, a bus journey, a cycle hire journey, a personal cycle journey and a walking journey

parameters.name: walkingOptimization
parameters.description: A boolean to indicate whether to optimize journeys using walking

get.summary: Gets a list of valid modes
Gets a list of valid severity codes
Gets a list of valid disruption categories
Gets a list of valid ServiceTypes to filter on
Gets lines that match the specified line ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

get.summary: Gets lines that serve the given modes.

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

get.summary: Get all valid routes for all lines, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route.

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary: Get all valid routes for given line ids, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary: Gets all lines and their valid routes for given modes, including the name and id of the originating and terminating stops for each route

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary: Gets all valid routes for given line id, including the sequence of stops on each route.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound.

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

parameters.name: excludeCrowding
parameters.description: That excludes crowding from line disruptions. Can be true or false.

get.summary: Gets the line status for given line ids during the provided dates e.g Minor Delays

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

get.summary: Gets the line status of for given line ids e.g Minor Delays

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

get.summary: Search for lines or routes matching the query string

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search term e.g victoria

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: Optionally filter by the specified modes

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of service types to filter on. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary:
Gets the line status for all lines with a given severity
            A list of valid severity codes can be obtained from a call to Line/Meta/Severity

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: The level of severity (eg: a number from 0 to 14)

get.summary: Gets the line status of for all lines for the given modes

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of modes to filter by. e.g. tube,dlr

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description: Include details of the disruptions that are causing the line status including the affected stops and routes

get.summary: Gets a list of the stations that serve the given line id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

get.summary: Gets the timetable for a specified station on the give line

parameters.name: fromStopPointId
parameters.description: The originating station's stop point id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

get.summary: Gets the timetable for a specified station on the give line with specified destination

parameters.name: fromStopPointId
parameters.description: The originating station's stop point id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single line id e.g. victoria

parameters.name: toStopPointId
parameters.description: The destination stations's Naptan code

get.summary: Get disruptions for the given line ids

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

get.summary: Get disruptions for all lines of the given modes.

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

get.summary: Get the list of arrival predictions for given line ids based at the given stop

parameters.description: Id of stop to get arrival predictions for (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

get.summary: Get the list of arrival predictions for given line ids based at the given stop going in the procided direction

parameters.name: stopPointId
parameters.description: Id of stop to get arrival predictions for (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of line ids e.g. victoria,circle,N133. Max. approx. 20 ids.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound

get.summary:
Returns the service type active for a mode.
            Currently only supports tube
Gets the next arrival predictions for all stops of a given mode

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: A mode name e.g. tube, dlr

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: A number of arrivals to return for each stop, -1 to return all available.

get.summary: Gets the occupancy for a car park with a given id
Gets the occupancy for all car parks that have occupancy data
Gets a list of all of the available place property categories and keys.
Gets a list of the available types of Place.
Gets the set of streets associated with a post code.
Gets all places of a given type

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx 12 types.
            A valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint.

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the results to active records only (Currently only the 'VariableMessageSign' place type is supported)

get.summary: Gets the place with the given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the place, you can use the /Place/Types/{types} endpoint to get a list of places for a given type including their ids

parameters.name: includeChildren
parameters.description: Defaults to false. If true child places e.g. individual charging stations at a charge point while be included, otherwise just the URLs of any child places will be returned

get.summary:
Gets the places that lie within the bounding box defined by the lat/lon of its north-west and south-east corners. Optionally filters
            on type and can strip properties for a smaller payload.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: an optional list of comma separated property categories to return in the Place's property bag. If null or empty, all categories of property are returned. Pass the keyword "none" to return no properties (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/categories endpoint)

parameters.name: includeChildren
parameters.description: Defaults to false. If true child places e.g. individual charging stations at a charge point while be included, otherwise just the URLs of any child places will be returned

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: place types to filter on, or null to return all types

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: An optional parameter to limit the results to active records only (Currently only the 'VariableMessageSign' place type is supported)

get.summary:
Gets any places of the given type whose geography intersects the given latitude and longitude. In practice this means the Place
            must be polygonal e.g. a BoroughBoundary.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The place type (a valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint)

get.summary: Gets the place overlay for a given set of co-ordinates and a given width/height.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The zoom level

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The place type (a valid list of place types can be obtained from the /Place/Meta/placeTypes endpoint)

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the requested overlay.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the requested overlay.

get.summary: Gets all places that matches the given query

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the place, you can use the /Place/Types/{types} endpoint to get a list of places for a given type including their names.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx 12 types.

get.summary: Gets all roads managed by TfL
Gets the road with the specified id (e.g. A1)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

get.summary: Gets the specified roads with the status aggregated over the date range specified, or now until the end of today if no dates are passed.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" or use "all" to ignore id filter (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

get.summary: Get active disruptions, filtered by road ids

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of road identifiers e.g. "A406, A2" use all for all to ignore id filter (a full list of supported road identifiers can be found at the /Road/ endpoint)

parameters.name: stripContent
parameters.description: Optional, defaults to false. When true, removes every property/node except for id, point, severity, severityDescription, startDate, endDate, corridor details, location, comments and streets

parameters.name: severities
parameters.description: an optional list of Severity names to filter on (a valid list of severities can be obtained from the /Road/Meta/severities endpoint)

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: an optional list of category names to filter on (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /Road/Meta/categories endpoint)

parameters.name: closures
parameters.description: Optional, defaults to true. When true, always includes disruptions that have road closures, regardless of the severity filter. When false, the severity filter works as normal.

get.summary: Gets a list of disrupted streets. If no date filters are provided, current disruptions are returned.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Optional, the start time to filter on.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Optional, The end time to filter on.

get.summary: Gets a list of active disruptions filtered by disruption Ids.

parameters.name: disruptionIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of disruption identifiers to filter by.

parameters.name: stripContent
parameters.description: Optional, defaults to false. When true, removes every property/node except for id, point, severity, severityDescription, startDate, endDate, corridor details, location and comments.

get.summary: Gets a list of valid RoadDisruption categories
Gets a list of valid RoadDisruption severity codes

Search the site for occurrences of the query string. The maximum number of results returned is equal to the maximum page size
            of 100. To return subsequent pages, use the paginated overload.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query

get.summary: Searches the bus schedules folder on S3 for a given bus number.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query

get.summary: Gets the available searchProvider names.
Gets the available search categories.
Gets the available sorting options.
Gets the list of available StopPoint additional information categories
Gets the list of available StopPoint types
Gets the list of available StopPoint modes
Gets a list of StopPoints corresponding to the given list of stop ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of stop point ids (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL). Max. approx. 20 ids.
            You can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name.

parameters.name: includeCrowdingData
parameters.description: Include the crowding data (static). To Filter further use: /StopPoint/{ids}/Crowding/{line}

get.summary: Gets all the Crowding data (static) for the StopPointId, plus crowding data for a given line and optionally a particular direction.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Naptan id of the stop

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: A particular line e.g. victoria, circle, northern etc.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel. Can be inbound or outbound.

get.summary: Gets all stop points of a given type

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of the types to return. Max. approx. 12 types. 
            A list of valid stop types can be obtained from the StopPoint/meta/stoptypes endpoint.

get.summary: Gets the service types for a given stoppoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Naptan id of the stop

parameters.name: lineIds
parameters.description: The lines which contain the given Naptan id (all lines relevant to the given stoppoint if empty)

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: The modes which the lines are relevant to (all if empty)

get.summary: Gets the list of arrival predictions for the given stop point id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A StopPoint id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

get.summary: Gets Stopoints that are reachable from a station/line combination.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name) of the stop point to filter by

parameters.name: lineId
parameters.description: Line id of the line to filter by (e.g. victoria)

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of service types to filter on. If not specified. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary: Returns the route sections for all the lines that service the given stop point ids

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A stop point id (station naptan codes e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: serviceTypes
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of service types to filter on. If not specified. Supported values: Regular, Night. Defaulted to 'Regular' if not specified

get.summary: Gets a distinct list of disrupted stop points for the given modes

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

get.summary: Gets all disruptions for the specified StopPointId, plus disruptions for any child Naptan records it may have.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
A comma-seperated list of stop point ids. Max. approx. 20 ids.
            You can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name.

parameters.name: getFamily
parameters.description: Specify true to return disruptions for entire family, or false to return disruptions for just this stop point. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: flattenResponse
parameters.description: Specify true to associate all disruptions with parent stop point. (Only applicable when getFamily is true).

get.summary: Returns the canonical direction, "inbound" or "outbound", for a given pair of stop point Ids in the direction from -> to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Originating stop id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: toStopPointId
parameters.description: Destination stop id (station naptan code e.g. 940GZZLUASL, you can use /StopPoint/Search/{query} endpoint to find a stop point id from a station name)

parameters.name: lineId
parameters.description: Optional line id filter e.g. victoria

get.summary: Gets a list of StopPoints within {radius} by the specified criteria

parameters.name: stopTypes
parameters.description: a list of stopTypes that should be returned (a list of valid stop types can be obtained from the StopPoint/meta/stoptypes endpoint)

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: the radius of the bounding circle in metres (default : 200)

parameters.name: useStopPointHierarchy
parameters.description: Re-arrange the output into a parent/child hierarchy

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: the list of modes to search (comma separated mode names e.g. tube,dlr)

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: an optional list of comma separated property categories to return in the StopPoint's property bag. If null or empty, all categories of property are returned. Pass the keyword "none" to return no properties (a valid list of categories can be obtained from the /StopPoint/Meta/categories endpoint)

parameters.name: returnLines
parameters.description: true to return the lines that each stop point serves as a nested resource

get.summary: Gets a list of StopPoints filtered by the modes available at that StopPoint.

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: A comma-seperated list of modes e.g. tube,dlr

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The data set page to return. Page 1 equates to the first 1000 stop points, page 2 equates to 1001-2000 etc. Must be entered for bus mode as data set is too large.

get.summary: Search StopPoints by their common name, or their 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string, case-insensitive. Leading and trailing wildcards are applied automatically.

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the modes to filter by

parameters.name: faresOnly
parameters.description: True to only return stations in that have Fares data available for single fares to another station.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
An optional result limit, defaulting to and with a maximum of 50. Since children of the stop point heirarchy are returned for matches,
            it is possible that the flattened result set will contain more than 50 items.

parameters.name: lines
parameters.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the lines to filter by

parameters.name: includeHubs
parameters.description: If true, returns results including HUBs.

get.summary: Search StopPoints by their common name, or their 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query string, case-insensitive. Leading and trailing wildcards are applied automatically.

parameters.name: modes
parameters.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the modes to filter by

parameters.name: faresOnly
parameters.description: True to only return stations in that have Fares data available for single fares to another station.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
An optional result limit, defaulting to and with a maximum of 50. Since children of the stop point heirarchy are returned for matches,
            it is possible that the flattened result set will contain more than 50 items.

parameters.name: lines
parameters.description: An optional, parameter separated list of the lines to filter by

parameters.name: includeHubs
parameters.description: If true, returns results including HUBs.

get.summary: Gets a StopPoint for a given sms code.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A 5-digit Countdown Bus Stop Code e.g. 73241, 50435, 56334.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: If set to "web", a 302 redirect to relevant website bus stop page is returned. Valid values are : web. All other values are ignored.

get.summary: Gets a list of taxi ranks corresponding to the given stop point id.

parameters.description: stopPointId is required to get the taxi ranks.

get.summary: Get car parks corresponding to the given stop point id.

parameters.name: stopPointId
parameters.description: stopPointId is required to get the car parks.

get.summary: Gets the Emissions Surcharge compliance for the Vehicle

parameters.name: vrm
parameters.description: The Vehicle Registration Mark

url.description: The unique location of this resource.

distance.description:
The distance of the place from its search point, if this is the result
            of a geographical search, otherwise zero.

placeType.description: The type of Place. See /Place/Meta/placeTypes for possible values.

additionalProperties.description: A bag of additional key/value pairs with extra information about this place.

label.description: The long label to show on maps when zoomed in

labelShort.description: The short label to show on maps

geography.description: A LineString or MultiLineString that forms the route of the highway

segmented.description: True if the route is split into segments

modified.description: When the data was last updated

types.description: The type of the place e.g. "street_address"

address.description: A string describing the formatted address of the place. Adds additional context to the place's Name.

ItineraryResult.description: A DTO representing a list of possible journeys.

Journey.description: Object that represents an end to end journey (see schematic).

instruction.description:
Describes the action the user need to take for this section, E.g. "walk to the
            district line"

Disruption.description: Represents a disruption to a route within the transport network.

category.description: Gets or sets the category of this dispruption.

type.description: Gets or sets the disruption type of this dispruption.

categoryDescription.description: Gets or sets the description of the category.

description.description: Gets or sets the description of this disruption.

additionalInfo.description: Gets or sets the additionaInfo of this disruption.

created.description: Gets or sets the date/time when this disruption was created.

lastUpdate.description: Gets or sets the date/time when this disruption was last updated.

affectedRoutes.description: Gets or sets the routes affected by this disruption

affectedStops.description: Gets or sets the stops affected by this disruption

direction.description: eg: N or S or I or O

passengerFlows.description: Busiest times at a station (static information)

trainLoadings.description: Train Loading on a scale 1-6, 1 being "Very quiet" and 6 being "Exceptionally busy" (static information)

Point.description: Represents a point located at a latitude and longitude using the WGS84 co-ordinate system.

lineIdentifier.description: The line identifier (e.g. District Line), from where you can obtain line status information e.g. the rainbow board status "good service".

direction.description: eg: N or S or I or O

indicator.description: The indicator of the stop point e.g. "Stop K"

stopLetter.description: The stop letter, if it could be cleansed from the Indicator e.g. "K"

url.description: The unique location of this resource.

distance.description:
The distance of the place from its search point, if this is the result
            of a geographical search, otherwise zero.

placeType.description: The type of Place. See /Place/Meta/placeTypes for possible values.

additionalProperties.description: A bag of additional key/value pairs with extra information about this place.

ValidityPeriod.description: Represents a period for which a planned works is valid.

fromDate.description: Gets or sets the start date.

toDate.description: Gets or sets the end date.

isNow.description: If true is a realtime status rather than planned or info

timeSlice.description: Time in 24hr format with 15 minute intervals e.g. 0500-0515, 0515-0530 etc.

value.description: Count of passenger flow towards a platform

lineDirection.description: Direction of the Line e.g. NB, SB, WB etc.

platformDirection.description: Direction displayed on the platform e.g. NB, SB, WB etc.

direction.description: Direction in regards to Journey Planner i.e. inbound or outbound

timeSlice.description: Time in 24hr format with 15 minute intervals e.g. 0500-0515, 0515-0530 etc.

value.description:
Scale between 1-6, 
             1 = Very quiet, 2 = Quiet, 3 = Fairly busy, 4 = Busy, 5 = Very busy, 6 = Exceptionally busy

nextBranchIds.description:
The ids of the next branch(es) in the sequence. Note that the next and previous branch id can be
            identical in the case of a looped route e.g. the Circle line.

prevBranchIds.description:
The ids of the previous branch(es) in the sequence. Note that the next and previous branch id can be
            identical in the case of a looped route e.g. the Circle line.

Prediction.description: DTO to capture the prediction details

operationType.description: The type of the operation (1: is new or has been updated, 2: should be deleted from any client cache)

vehicleId.description: The actual vehicle in transit (for train modes, the leading car of the rolling set)

platformName.description: Platform name (for bus, this is the stop letter)

destinationNaptanId.description: Naptan Identifier for the prediction's destination

timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the prediction was inserted/modified (source column drives what objects are broadcast on each iteration)

timeToStation.description: Prediction of the Time to station in seconds

currentLocation.description: The current location of the vehicle.

towards.description: Routing information or other descriptive text about the path of the vehicle towards the destination

expectedArrival.description: The expected arrival time of the vehicle at the stop/station

timeToLive.description: The expiry time for the prediction

modeName.description: The mode name of the station/line the prediction relates to

timing.description: Keep the original timestamp from MongoDb fo debugging purposes

id.description: The Id of the Corridor e.g. "A406"

displayName.description:
The display name of the Corridor e.g. "North Circular (A406)". This
            may be identical to the Id.

group.description: The group name of the Corridor e.g. "Central London". Most corridors are not grouped, in which case this field can be null.

statusSeverityDescription.description: Description of the status severity as applied to RoadCorridors

bounds.description:
The Bounds of the Corridor, given by the south-east followed by the north-west co-ordinate
            pair in geoJSON format e.g. "[[-1.241531,51.242151],[1.641223,53.765721]]"

envelope.description:
The Envelope of the Corridor, given by the corner co-ordinates of a rectangular (four-point) polygon
            in geoJSON format e.g. "[[-1.241531,51.242151],[-1.241531,53.765721],[1.641223,53.765721],[1.641223,51.242151]]"

statusAggregationStartDate.description: The start of the period over which status has been aggregated, or null if this is the current corridor status.

statusAggregationEndDate.description: The end of the period over which status has been aggregated, or null if this is the current corridor status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the road disruption

url.description: URL to retrieve this road disruption

point.description: Latitude and longitude (WGS84) of the centroid of the disruption, stored in a geoJSON-formatted string.

severity.description: A description of the severity of the disruption.

ordinal.description: An ordinal of the disruption based on severity, level of interest and corridor.

category.description: Describes the nature of disruption e.g. Traffic Incidents, Works

subCategory.description: Describes the sub-category of disruption e.g. Collapsed Manhole, Abnormal Load

comments.description: Full text of comments describing the disruption, including details of any road closures and diversions, where appropriate.

currentUpdate.description:
Text of the most recent update from the LSTCC on the state of the
             disruption, including the current traffic impact and any advice to
             road users.

currentUpdateDateTime.description:
The time when the last CurrentUpdate description was recorded, 
            or null if no CurrentUpdate has been applied.

corridorIds.description: The Ids of affected corridors, if any.

startDateTime.description:
The date and time which the disruption started. For a planned disruption (i.e. planned road works) this date will be in the future.
            For unplanned disruptions, this will default to the date on which the disruption was first recorded, but may be adjusted by the operator.

endDateTime.description:
The date and time on which the disruption ended. For planned disruptions, this date will have a valid value. For unplanned 
            disruptions in progress, this field will be omitted.

lastModifiedTime.description:
The date and time on which the disruption was last modified in the system. This information can reliably be used by a developer to quickly
            compare two instances of the same disruption to determine if it has been changed.

levelOfInterest.description:
This describes the level of potential impact on traffic operations of the disruption. 
            High = e.g. a one-off disruption on a major or high profile route which will require a high level of operational attention 
            Medium = This is the default value 
            Low = e.g. a frequently occurring disruption which is well known

location.description: Main road name / number (borough) or preset area name where the disruption is located. This might be useful for a map popup where space is limited.

status.description:
This describes the status of the disruption.  
            Active = currently in progress 
            Active Long Term = currently in progress and long term
            Scheduled = scheduled to start within the next 180 days
            Recurring Works = planned maintenance works that follow a regular routine or pattern and whose next occurrence is to start within the next 180 days.
            Recently Cleared = recently cleared in the last 24 hours
            Note that the status of Scheduled or Recurring Works disruptions will change to Active when they start, and will change status again when they end.

geography.description:
Geography version of Point for output as GeoJSON.
            Can not use Geometry in a consistent way as non-TIMS disruptions do not have a polygon

geometry.description:
GeoJSON formatted latitude/longitude (WGS84) pairs forming an enclosed polyline or polygon. The polygon will only be included where affected streets information
            is not available for the disruption, would be inappropriate (e.g. a very large number of streets), or is centred on an area without streets (e.g. a football stadium).

streets.description: A collection of zero or more streets affected by the disruption.

isProvisional.description: True if the disruption is planned on a future date that is open to change

hasClosures.description:
True if any of the affected Streets have a "Full Closure" status, false otherwise. A RoadDisruption that has HasClosures is considered a 
            Severe or Serious disruption for severity filtering purposes.

linkText.description: The text of any associated link

linkUrl.description: The url of any associated link

closure.description:
Type of road closure. Some example values:
            Open = road is open, not blocked, not closed, not restricted. It maybe that the disruption has been moved out of the carriageway.
            Partial Closure = road is partially blocked, closed or restricted. 
            Full Closure = road is fully blocked or closed.

directions.description:
The direction of the disruption on the street. Some example values:
            All Directions
            All Approaches
            Clockwise
            Anti-Clockwise
            Northbound
            Eastbound
            Southbound
            Westbound
            Both Directions

segments.description: Geographic description of the sections of this street that are affected.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID from the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

sourceSystemKey.description: The key of the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

toid.description: A 16 digit unique integer identifying a OS ITN (Ordnance Survey Integrated Transport Network) road link.

lineString.description: geoJSON formatted LineString containing two latitude/longitude (WGS84) pairs that identify the start and end points of the street segment.

sourceSystemId.description: The ID from the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

sourceSystemKey.description: The key of the source system of the disruption that this street belongs to.

centrePoint.description: The centre latitude/longitude of this list of StopPoints

pageSize.description: The maximum size of the page in this response i.e. the maximum number of StopPoints

total.description: The total number of StopPoints available across all pages
